intro: Crocanthemum dumosum, commonly known as the bushy ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, often yellow or orange-colored blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as moths. Its succulent leaves and stems allow it to store water, making it adapted to arid environments. Crocanthemum dumosum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
